main event: A white brilliantly lighted object, resembling a balloon, with irregular lights and a bright flash, was observed 5 miles west of Bismarck, North Dakota on 18th August 1958. The object was seen overhead, then moved slowly to the east before disappearing.
interesting points: The object was initially mistaken for a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical phenomenon.
It emitted a bright flash followed by a white glow.
The observation lasted 40 minutes, suggesting a prolonged sighting.
The observer used binoculars to get a better view of the object.
The report includes evaluations suggesting the object could potentially be a weather balloon or a natural phenomenon.
sighted object: white brilliantly lighted object resembling a balloon with irregular lights
location: 5 miles west of Bismarck, North Dakota
witnesses: Mr. Postal Clerk of Bismarck, North Dakota
